trans-unit.source: Encapsulates a File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server's response to a request.
Instances of FtpWebResponse are obtained by calling the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebRequest.GetResponse%2A> method.
The returned object must be cast to an FtpWebResponse.
When your application no longer needs the FtpWebResponse object, call the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebResponse.Close%2A> method to free the resources held by the FtpWebResponse.

The <xref:System.Net.FtpWebResponse.StatusCode%2A> property contains the status code returned by the server, and the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebResponse.StatusDescription%2A> property returns the status code and a message that describes the status.
The values returned by these properties change as the messages are returned by the server.

Any data returned by the request, such as the list of file names returned for a <xref:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.ListDirectory> request, is available in the stream returned by the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebResponse.GetResponseStream%2A> method.
The length of the stream data can be obtained from the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebResponse.ContentLength%2A> property.
Gets the message sent by the FTP server when a connection is established prior to logon.
A <xref:System.String> that contains the banner message sent by the server; otherwise, <xref:System.String> if no message is sent.
Frees the resources held by the response.
The Close method closes the data stream returned by the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebResponse.GetResponseStream%2A> method if the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebRequest.KeepAlive%2A> property is `false`.
During the close, data might be sent to the server on the control connection.
> [!NOTE] > This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application.
For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Gets the length of the data received from the FTP server.
When a response stream is returned by the FTP server, the ContentLength property contains the number of bytes in the stream.
ContentLength returns −1 if no data was returned in the response or if the server did not send content length information.
The return value is greater than or equal to zero if data was or should have been returned.
For example, for requests that use the <xref:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.ListDirectory> field, the ContentLength property always returns −1.
For requests that use the <xref:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.UploadFile> method, the ContentLength property is always zero.
For requests that use the <xref:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.DownloadFile> method, the property is greater than zero if the downloaded file contained data and is zero if it was empty.
For requests that use the <xref:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.GetFileSize> method, ContentLength returns the size of the specified file on the server.
An <xref:System.Int64> value that contains the number of bytes of data received from the FTP server.
Gets the message sent by the server when the FTP session is ending.
The ExitMessage property is not available until the connection to the server is closed or reused.
If the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebRequest.KeepAlive%2A> property is `true`, the connection used by this request is not closed, which prevents the server from sending an exit message.
A <xref:System.String> that contains the exit message sent by the server; otherwise, <xref:System.String> if no message is sent.
Retrieves the stream that contains response data sent from an FTP server.
After reading the data, you must close the stream.
The stream is automatically closed when you close the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebResponse> object that contains it.
An exception is thrown unless the request method is <xref:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.DownloadFile> or <xref:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.ListDirectory>.
A readable <xref:System.IO.Stream> instance that contains data returned with the response; otherwise, <xref:System.IO.Stream> if no response data was returned by the server.
The response did not return a data stream.
Gets an empty <xref:System.Net.WebHeaderCollection> object.
The Headers property is provided only for compatibility with other implementations of the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> and <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> classes.
An empty <xref:System.Net.WebHeaderCollection> object.
Gets the date and time that a file on an FTP server was last modified.
The LastModified property returns the data requested by the <xref:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.GetDateTimestamp> method.
For requests sent using any other method, LastModified returns <xref:System.DateTime.MinValue>.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that contains the last modified date and time for a file.
Gets the URI that sent the response to the request.

Because of server- and resource-specific behaviors, such as redirection, the value returned by the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebRequest.RequestUri%2A> property is not always the same as the value returned by the ResponseUri property.
For requests that use the <xref:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.UploadFileWithUniqueName> method, ResponseUri returns the name of the file on the server.
A <xref:System.Uri> instance that identifies the resource associated with this response.
Gets the most recent status code sent from the FTP server.
The value returned by the StatusCode property is included in the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebResponse.StatusDescription%2A> property.
When you are downloading data, the value of StatusCode changes as status codes are returned by the FTP server.
After you call the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebRequest.GetResponse%2A> method, StatusCode contains an intermediate status code.
When you call the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebResponse.Close%2A> method, StatusCode contains the final status.
An <xref href="System.Net.FtpStatusCode"></xref> value that indicates the most recent status code returned with this response.
Gets text that describes a status code sent from the FTP server.
The text returned by the StatusDescription property includes the 3-digit <xref:System.Net.FtpWebResponse.StatusCode%2A> property value.
When downloading data, the value of StatusDescription changes as status codes are returned by the FTP server.
After you call the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebRequest.GetResponse%2A> method, StatusDescription contains an intermediate status code.
When you call the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebResponse.Close%2A> method, StatusDescription contains the final status.
A <xref:System.String> instance that contains the status code and message returned with this response.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebResponse.Headers*> property is supported by the <xref href="System.Net.FtpWebResponse"></xref> instance.
This property is always true for [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
Returns <xref:System.Boolean>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebResponse.Headers*> property is supported by the <xref href="System.Net.FtpWebResponse"></xref> instance; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the message sent by the FTP server when authentication is complete.

If the connection is being reused (the <xref:System.Net.FtpWebRequest.KeepAlive%2A> property is set to `true`), the WelcomeMessage property returns the first welcome message received with the connection.
A <xref:System.String> that contains the welcome message sent by the server; otherwise, <xref:System.String> if no message is sent.
